Here you can find the full repository of notes from previous UQRUG Meetings

UQRUG 33

Presentation on gganimate and plotly animations Nick Wiggins did a presentation on animations in gganimate and plotly. He showed some examples of how these can be used to make your graphs somewhat more interesting, and in the case of plotly, interactive. gganimate plotly
December 7, 2022

UQRUG 32

Nick Wiggins did a presentation on the quanteda package to give an overview and introduction to the package and how he has recently used it to assist a researcher. https://quanteda.io/
October 26, 2022

UQRUG 31

Covered some of the basics around creating, and the differences between, arrays and dataframes.
September 28, 2022

UQRUG 30

How to read multiple csv files in as separate variables efficiently for a Shiny app. Looked at creating a list of files, and then using the read_csv function in rdrr package to read them in.
August 24, 2022

UQRUG 29

Creating a normal distribution line for a histogram. Using ggplot geom_histogram() and the stat_function() creates the plot, but the line and histogram are scaled differently on the y axis.
July 27, 2022
